component.title: Control Name
component.p: Low FedRAMP-Defined Assignment / Selection Parameters (Numbering matches SSP)
LM Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance

component.title: ACCESS CONTROL POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: AC-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] AC-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT
component.p: AC-2 (j) [at least annually]

component.title: UNSUCCESSFUL LOGON ATTEMPTS
component.p: AC-7(a) [not more than three] [fifteen minutes] AC-7(b) [locks the account/node for thirty minutes]

component.title: SYSTEM USE NOTIFICATION
component.p: AC-8 (a) [see additional Requirements and Guidance] AC-8 (c) [see additional Requirements and Guidance]

AC-8 Requirement: The service provider shall determine elements of the cloud environment that require the System Use Notification control. The elements of the cloud environment that require System Use Notification are approved and accepted by the JAB. AC-08 Requirement: The service provider shall determine how System Use Notification is going to be verified and provide appropriate periodicity of the check. The System Use Notification verification and periodicity are approved and accepted by the JAB. AC-8 Guidance: If performed as part of a Configuration Baseline check, then the % of items requiring setting that are checked and that pass (or fail) check can be provided. AC-8 Requirement: If not performed as part of a Configuration Baseline check, then there must be documented agreement on how to provide results of verification and the necessary periodicity of the verification by the service provider. The documented agreement on how to provide verification of the results are approved and accepted by the JAB.

component.title: PERMITTED ACTIONS WITHOUT IDENTIFICATION OR AUTHENTICATION
PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE CONTENT
component.p: AC-22 (d) [at least quarterly]

component.title: SECURITY AWARENESS AND TRAINING POLICY ANDPROCEDURES
component.p: AT-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] AT-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: SECURITY AWARENESS TRAINING
component.p: AT-2(c) [at least annually]

component.title: ROLE-BASED SECURITY TRAINING
component.p: AT-3 (c) [at least annually]

component.title: SECURITY TRAINING RECORDS
component.p: AT-4 (b) [At least one year]

component.title: AUDIT AND ACCOUNTABILITY POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: AU-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] AU-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: AUDIT EVENTS
component.p: AU-2 (a) [Successful and unsuccessful account logon events, account management events, object access, policy change, privilege functions, process tracking, and system events For Web applications: all administrator activity, authentication checks, authorization checks, data deletions, data access, data changes, and permission changes] AU-2 (d) [organization-defined subset of the auditable events defined in AU-2 a to be audited continually for each identified event]
AU-2 Requirement: Coordination between service provider and consumer shall be documented and accepted by the JAB/AO.

component.title: RESPONSE TO AUDIT PROCESSING FAILURES
component.p: AU-5 (b) [organization-defined actions to be taken (overwrite oldest record)

component.title: AUDIT REVIEW, ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING
component.p: AU-6 (a)-1 [at least weekly]

AU-6 Requirement: Coordination between service provider and consumer shall be documented and accepted by the JAB/AO. In multi-tennant environments, capability and means for providing review, analysis, and reporting to consumer for data pertaining to consumer shall be documented.

component.title: AUDIT RECORD RETENTION
component.p: AU-11 [at least ninety days]
AU-11. Requirement: The service provider retains audit records on-line for at least ninety days and further preserves audit records off-line for a period that is in accordance with NARA requirements.

component.title: AUDIT GENERATION
component.p: AU-12 (a) [all information system and network components where audit capability is deployed/available]

component.title: SECURITY ASSESSMENT AND AUTHORIZATION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: CA-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] CA-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: SECURITY ASSESSMENTS
component.p: CA-2 (b) [at least annually] CA-2 (d) [individuals or roles to include FedRAMP PMO]

component.title: INDEPENDENT ASSESSORS
component.p: CA-2(1) Requirement: Must use an accredited 3PAO for JAB authorization

component.title: SYSTEM INTERCONNECTIONS
component.p: CA-3 (c) [at least annually and on input from FedRAMP]

component.title: PLAN OF ACTION AND MILESTONES
component.p: CA-5 (b) [at least monthly]
CA-5 Guidance: Requirement: POA&Ms must be provided at least monthly.

component.title: SECURITY AUTHORIZATION
component.p: CA-6 (c) [at least every three years or when a significant change occurs]

CA-6c. Guidance: Significant change is defined in NIST Special Publication 800-37 Revision 1, Appendix F. The service provider describes the types of changes to the information system or the environment of operations that would impact the risk posture. The types of changes are approved and accepted by the JAB/AO.

component.title: CONTINUOUS MONITORING
component.p: CA-7 (g) [To meet Federal and FedRAMP requirements]

CA-7 Requirement: Operating System Scans: at least monthly Database and Web Application Scans: at least monthly All scans performed by Independent Assessor: at least annually CA-7 Guidance: CSPs must provide evidence of closure and remediation of high vulnerabilities within the timeframe for standard POA&M updates. Operating System Scans: at least monthly Database and Web Application Scans: at least monthly All scans performed by Independent Assessor: at least annually

component.title: CONFIGURATION MANAGEMENT POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: CM-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] CM-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: CONFIGURATION SETTINGS
component.p: CM-6 (a) [United States Government Configuration Baseline (USGCB)]

CM-6 (a) Requirement 1: The service provider shall use the Center for Internet Security guidelines (Level 1) to establish configuration settings or establishes its own configuration settings if USGCB is not available. CM-6 (a) Requirement 2: The service provider shall ensure that checklists for configuration settings are Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) validated or SCAP compatible (if validated checklists are not available). CM-6 (a) Guidance: Information on the USGCB checklists can be found at: http://usgcb.nist.gov/usgcb_faq.html#usgcbfaq_usgcbfdcc

component.title: LEAST FUNCTIONALITY
component.p: CM-7 (b) [United States Government Configuration Baseline (USGCB)]

CM-7 (b) Requirement: The service provider shall use the Center for Internet Security guidelines (Level 1) to establish list of prohibited or restricted functions, ports, protocols, and/or services or establishes its own list of prohibited or restricted functions, ports, protocols, and/or services if USGCB is not available. CM-7. Guidance: Information on the USGCB checklists can be found at: http://usgcb.nist.gov/usgcb_faq.html#usgcbfaq_usgcbfdcc. (Partially derived from AC-17(8).)

component.title: INFORMATION SYSTEM COMPONENT INVENTORY
component.p: CM-8 (b) [at least monthly]
CM-8 Requirement: must be provided at least monthly or when there is a change.

component.title: USER-INSTALLED SOFTWARE
component.p: CM-11 (c) [Continuously (via CM-7 (5))]

component.title: CONTINGENCY PLANNING POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: CP-1 (b)(1) [at least every 3 years] CP-1 (b)(2) [at least annually]

component.title: CONTINGENCY PLAN
component.p: CP-2 (d) [at least annually]
CP-2 Requirement: For JAB authorizations the contingency lists include designated FedRAMP personnel.

component.title: CONTINGENCY TRAINING
component.p: CP-3 (a) [10 days] CP-3 (c) [at least annually]

component.title: CONTINGENCY PLAN TESTING
component.p: CP-4 (a)-1 [at least annually for moderate impact systems; at least every three years for low impact systems] CP-4 (a)-2 [functional exercises for moderate impact systems; classroom exercises/table top written tests for low impact systems]
CP-4 (a). Requirement: The service provider develops test plans in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-34 (as amended); plans are approved by the JAB/AO prior to initiating testing.

component.title: INFORMATION SYSTEM BACKUP
component.p: CP-9 (a) [daily incremental; weekly full] CP-9 (b) [daily incremental; weekly full] CP-9 (c) [daily incremental; weekly full]

CP-9 Requirement: The service provider shall determine what elements of the cloud environment require the Information System Backup control. The service provider shall determine how Information System Backup is going to be verified and appropriate periodicity of the check. CP-9 (a) Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of user-level information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative. CP-9 (b) Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of system-level information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative. CP-9 (c) Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of information system documentation including security information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative.

component.title: IDENTIFICATION AND AUTHENTICATION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: IA-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] IA-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: ACCEPTANCE OF PIV CREDENTIALS
component.p: IA-2 (12) Guidance: Include Common Access Card (CAC), i.e., the DoD technical implementation of PIV/FIPS 201/HSPD-12.

component.title: IDENTIFIER MANAGEMENT
component.p: IA-4 (d) [at least two years] IA-4 (e) [ninety days for user identifiers] (See additional requirements and guidance)

IA-4 (e) Requirement: The service provider defines time period of inactivity for device identifiers. Guidance: For DoD clouds, see DoD cloud website for specific DoD requirements that go above and beyond FedRAMP http://iase.disa.mil/cloud_security/Pages/index.aspx.

component.title: AUTHENTICATOR MANAGEMENT
component.p: IA-5 (g) [to include sixty days for passwords]

component.title: PASSWORD-BASED AUTHENTICATION
component.p: IA-5 (1) (a) [case sensitive, minimum of twelve characters, and at least one each of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters] IA-5 (1) (b) [at least one] IA-5 (1) (d) [one day minimum, sixty day maximum] IA-5 (1) (e) [twenty four]

component.title: ACCEPTANCE OF PIV CREDENTIALS FROM OTHER AGENCIES
INCIDENT RESPONSE POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: IR-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] IR-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: INCIDENT RESPONSE TRAINING
component.p: IR-2 (c) [at least annually]

component.title: INCIDENT HANDLING
component.p: IR-4 Requirement: The service provider ensures that individuals conducting incident handling meet personnel security requirements commensurate with the criticality/sensitivity of the information being processed, stored, and transmitted by the information system.

component.title: INCIDENT REPORTING
component.p: IR-6 (a) [US-CERT incident reporting timelines as specified in NIST Special Publication 800-61 (as amended)]
IR-6 Requirement: Reports security incident information according to FedRAMP Incident Communications Procedure.

component.title: INCIDENT RESPONSE PLAN
component.p: IR-8 (b) [see additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance] IR-8 (c) [at least annually] IR-8 (e) [see additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance]

IR-8 (b) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: The service provider defines a list of incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements. The incident response list includes designated FedRAMP personnel. IR-8 (e) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: The service provider defines a list of incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements. The incident response list includes designated FedRAMP personnel.

component.title: SYSTEM MAINTENANCE POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: MA-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] MA-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: MEDIA PROTECTION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: MP-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] MP-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: PE-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] PE-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: PHYSICAL ACCESS AUTHORIZATIONS
component.p: PE-2 (c) [at least annually]

component.title: PHYSICAL ACCESS CONTROL
component.p: PE-3 (a) (2) [CSP defined physical access control systems/devices AND guards] PE-3 (d) [in all circumstances within restricted access area where the information system resides] PE-3 (f) [at least annually] PE-3 (g) [at least annually]

component.title: MONITORING PHYSICAL ACCESS
component.p: PE-6 (b) [at least monthly]

component.title: VISITOR ACCESS RECORDS
component.p: PE-8 (a) [for a minimum of one year] PE-8 (b) [at least monthly]

component.title: TEMPERATURE AND HUMIDITY CONTROLS
component.p: PE-14 (a) [consistent with American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE) document entitled Thermal Guidelines for Data Processing Environments] PE-14 (b) [continuously]
PE-14 (a). Requirements: The service provider measures temperature at server inlets and humidity levels by dew point.

component.title: DELIVERY AND REMOVAL
component.p: PE-16 [all information system components]

component.title: SECURITY PLANNING POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: PL-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] PL-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: SYSTEM SECURITY PLAN
component.p: PL-2 (c) [at least annually]

component.title: RULES OF BEHAVIOR
component.p: PL-4 (c) [At least every 3 years]

component.title: PERSONNEL SECURITY POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: PS-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] PS-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: POSITION RISK DESIGNATION
component.p: PS-2 (c) [at least every three years]

component.title: PERSONNEL SCREENING
component.p: PS-3 (b) [for national security clearances; a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year for top secret security clearance, the 10th year for secret security clearance, and 15th year for confidential security clearance For moderate risk law enforcement and high impact public trust level, a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year There is no reinvestigation for other moderate risk positions or any low risk positions]

component.title: PERSONNEL TERMINATION
component.p: PS-4 (a) [same day]

component.title: PERSONNEL TRANSFER
component.p: PS-5 (d)-2 [five days of the time period following the formal transfer action (DoD 24 hours)]

component.title: ACCESS AGREEMENTS
component.p: PS-6 (b) [at least annually] PS-6 (c) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: THIRD-PARTY PERSONNEL SECURITY
component.p: PS-7 (d)-2 [organization-defined time period â€“ same day]

component.title: RISK ASSESSMENT POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: RA-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] RA-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: RISK ASSESSMENT
component.p: RA-3 (b) [security assessment report] RA-3 (c) [at least every three (3) years or when a significant change occurs] RA-3 (d) [to include all Authoring Officials and FedRAMP ISSOs] RA-3 (e) [at least every three (3) years or when a significant change occurs]
RA-3 Guidance: Significant change is defined in NIST Special Publication 800-37 Revision 1, Appendix F.

component.title: VULNERABILITY SCANNING
component.p: RA-5 (a) [monthly operating system/infrastructure; monthly web applications and databases] RA-5 (d) [high-risk vulnerabilities mitigated within thirty days from date of discovery; moderate-risk vulnerabilities mitigated within ninety days from date of discovery]

RA-5 (a) Requirement: an accredited independent assessor scans operating systems/infrastructure, web applications, and databases once annually. RA-5 (e) Requirement: to include the Risk Executive; for JAB authorizations to include FedRAMP

component.title: SYSTEM AND SERVICES ACQUISITION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: SA-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] SA-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: ACQUISITION PROCESS
component.p: SA-4 Guidance: The use of Common Criteria (ISO/IEC 15408) evaluated products is strongly preferred. See http://www.niap-ccevs.org/vpl or http://www.commoncriteriaportal.org/products.html.

component.title: EXTERNAL INFORMATION SYSTEM SERVICES
component.p: SA-9 (a) [FedRAMP Security Controls Baseline(s) if Federal information is processed or stored within the external system] SA-9 (c) [Federal/FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring requirements must be met for external systems where Federal information is processed or stored]

component.title: SYSTEM AND COMMUNICATIONS PROTECTION POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: SC-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] SC-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: CRYPTOGRAPHIC KEY ESTABLISHMENT AND MANAGEMENT
component.p: SC-12 Guidance: Federally approved cryptography

component.title: CRYPTOGRAPHIC PROTECTION
component.p: SC-13 [FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography]

component.title: COLLABORATIVE COMPUTING DEVICES
component.p: SC-15 (a) [no exceptions]

SC-15 Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: Requirement: The information system provides disablement (instead of physical disconnect) of collaborative computing devices in a manner that supports ease of use.

component.title: SECURE NAME /ADDRESS RESOLUTION SERVICE (RECURSIVE OR CACHING RESOLVER)
ARCHITECTURE AND PROVISIONING FOR NAME/ADDRESS RESOLUTION SERVICE
SYSTEM AND INFORMATION INTEGRITY POLICY AND PROCEDURES
component.p: SI-1 (b) (1) [at least every 3 years] SI-1 (b) (2) [at least annually]

component.title: FLAW REMEDIATION
component.p: SI-2 (c) [within 30 days of release of updates]

component.title: MALICIOUS CODE PROTECTION
component.p: SI-3 (c) (1)-1 [at least weekly] SI-3 (c) (1)-2 [to include endpoints] SI-3 (c) (2) [to include alerting administrator or defined security personnel]

component.title: INFORMATION SYSTEM MONITORING
component.p: SI-4 Guidance: See US-CERT Incident Response Reporting Guidelines.

component.title: SECURITY ALERTS, ADVISORIES, AND DIRECTIVES
component.p: SI-5 (a) [to include US-CERT] SI-5 (c) [to include system security personnel and administrators with configuration/patch-management responsibilities]
